alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 4:47PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST/845 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona between Dilkon and Keams Canyon within Navajo County. * WHEN...Until 745 PM MST /845 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. Unimproved roadways may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 444 PM MST /544 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tees Toh Wash, Ha-whi-yalin Wash, Keams Canyon Wash, Coyote Wash and Jeddito Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keams Canyon, Cedar Springs, Jadito, Jeddito, Dilkon, Navajo, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. - This includes State Route 264 between mile markers 403 and 409. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
